channel.title: Blog on Terminal
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Terminal

item.title: It Works
item.description:
If your reading this it worked !!!

Amazing you’ve now got your own static website hosted in docker but don’t stop now try running it from your own repo using the below command. Don’t forget to change the repo URL Note this only works for public repos

docker run -d --restart always -p 80:80 \
    -e GIT_REPO_URL="https://github.com/example-user/example-repo.git" \
    -e GIT_BRANCH="main" \
    --name my-static-site \
    meeaehlabs/static-site:latest

If you have a Private Repo you need to use the below command
item.content:
If your reading this it worked !!!

Amazing you’ve now got your own static website hosted in docker but don’t stop now try running it from your own repo using the below command. Don’t forget to change the repo URL Note this only works for public repos

docker run -d --restart always -p 80:80 \
    -e GIT_REPO_URL="https://github.com/example-user/example-repo.git" \
    -e GIT_BRANCH="main" \
    --name my-static-site \
    meeaehlabs/static-site:latest

If you have a Private Repo you need to use the below command

docker run -d --restart always -p 80:80 \
    -e GIT_REPO_URL="https://yourgitusername:classicgittoken@github.com/example-user/example-repo.git" \
    -e GIT_BRANCH="main" \
    --name my-static-site \
    meeaehlabs/static-site:latest
